content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here is how you can define the `FloatWithUnits` struct and its `show` method:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits{T <: Real}
    value::T
    unit::String
end

Base.show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits) = print(io, "$(fwu.value) $(fwu.unit)")
```

This `show` method will take an IO stream and a `FloatWithUnits` object as input. It then prints the value and unit of the `FloatWithUnits` object to the provided IO stream. The string interpolation (`"$variable") is used to ensure that the value and unit are printed with a space in between.
